title: Upgrading from Win10 to Win11
content:
Hello,

I run Thunderbird 128.8.1 POP. I'm upgrading my Win10 computer to Win11.

Can I leave Thunderbird as-is and just upgrade to Win11 or do I have to uninstall it, upgrade to Win11, and then download a Thunderbird Win11 installer and re-install it.

Please tell me the steps to follow and provide any links to installers, etc..

Thank you so much, Scott
creator: scottnell

title: Passwords/Logins not stored when using network drive
content:
Hi @ all,

When using TB as a LDAP-User, logins.json and key4.db are NOT created on the (mounted) home directory.

here's my setup: Debian 12 with a local user as well as remote users, administrated via LDAP. PAM-login for local and ldap users has been setup and is working. Automounting of network drives is working. Each LDAP user has their home directory stored on a Fileserver and mounted upon login. All applications are working as intended except thunderbird.

So far I've tried to run gnupg locally instead of having it start a session from the (mounted) home directory, assuming that gnupg is the corresponding means of de/encryption. I've copied the profile of the local user to be used as the profile of the LDAP user, logins.json is completely ignored by TB.

Upon starting of TB, passwords are asked for and are remembered in the session. But passwords/logins are not stored and available for the next session.

Any ideas?
creator: jamestibiriuskirk

title: V115.18.0 How to get date and time search to work?
content:
I have messages which the message list shows as Date 2024-07-01, 18:00.

But Search Messages with "Date is 2024-07-01, 18:00" fails to find any messages.

Is this a known bug? Any workaround?
creator: firefox.com.yes.really

title: Password not accepted
content: Trying to set up a Thunderbird account on a surface book 3 and it refused to accept the password. I did a manual configuration and all the settings are copied from my desktop app so the server settings should all be correct. Now it does all the right things when I click the get messages button i.e. it says 'connected to mail.xxxx.net.au' but that's it. Nothing is sent or received.

title: Reinstallazione Thunderbird
content: Non riuscendo più ad aprire il programma in quanto mi viene chiesto in loop il riavvio del pc per completare un aggiornamento di Thunderbird, leggendo i vari post a riguardo ho provato a procedere alla disinstallazione del programma per poi reinstallarlo, ma anche se seguo le procedure di disinstallazione mi esce sempre la richiesta di riavvio, idem se provo a installare l'aggiornamento del programma senza disinstallare il precedente
creator: avanzino

title: thunderbird 客户端占用本地硬盘过大
content: 我的邮件客户端为128.7.1，用的时IMAP协议。在客户端界面显示收件箱（包括收件箱下级文件夹）总共大小为78GB,但是在%appdata%中的thunderbird文件夹却有恐怖的795GB！！！我尝试压缩收件箱但显示只压缩了7.5GB。。有人知道这是什么问题吗？我应该怎样减小%appdata%中的thunderbird文件夹的大小？谢谢。
creator: hsy906

title: thunderbird 128.7.1esr (64-bit) does not open message attachments except of pdf
content: Thunderbird email client 128.7.1esr (64-bit) running on Fedora 41 does not open email attachments except of pdf. The attachments are shown, context menu appears, but click on Open does nothing (except of PDF files, those are opened and shown). All other types of attachment I have to save somewhere and open from there. How to repair it? Thanks, Jiri Rohlicek

title: calendari di google in thunderbird (provider per google calendar) non vengono aggiornati
content:
i calendari di google in TB non vengono aggiornati; se io voglio inserire un nuovo appuntamento o modificarne uno esistente non posso farlo; gli avvisi degli appuntamenti scaduti dal 18/3 ad oggi non possono essere eliminati. Io penso che sia dovuto agli aggiornamenti di provider google calendar di questi ultimi giorni, voi cosa dite? Ho aperto la console degli errori, ci sono diversi messaggi simili a questo: Calendar: [calGoogleCalendar] Modifying item ACLI failed:2147500033: Item type not supported gdataCalendar.sys.mjs:582:13 

   modifyItem resource://gdata-provider/legacy/modules/gdataCalendar.sys.mjs?version=128.5.1:582    doModifyItem resource:///modules/CalCachedCalendar.sys.mjs:860

Grazie per ogni aiuto Aurelio
creator: aurelio.ghilardi

title: Thunderbird 136.0.1 (local) calendar notifications for events are partly not working
content: I got a new PC with Windows 11. I installed Thunderbird, activated the private calendar, and entered events there. For events with a reminder that have a specific duration (e.g., Wednesday from 10 AM to 11 AM), I receive notifications. However, when I create a full-day event and want to be reminded, for example, 1 day before, I don't receive any notification. Additionally, events with a reminder are not shown in bold in the calendar overview (whether they have a specific duration or are all-day events). Can you please help me?
creator: T-M-

title: V115.18.0 How to search for time?
content:
How can I search messages' Date field for a time? e.g. to find all messages at a certain time in any day.

"Date is 18:51" fails to match.

If I create a custom field "Date" which apparently presents the field as plain text, "Date contains 18:51" matches e.g. Date: Sun, 5 Nov 2017 18:51:34 +0000 but I believe fails to recognise time offset.

Thanks.

title: Calendar is locked - I cannot add or delete items
content: Hello, Yesterday the Google calendar tab opened with a message and stupidly I didn't read it - I just closed the tab and thought I'd check it later. And finally, I found I could not get the Google Calendar tab to re-open. I'm not sure if there has been a recent update which may have brought this about but any help would be very much appreciated. Thank you.

title: Unable to enter tasks after autoupdate to 128.8.1esr (64-bit)
content:
I came into my home office this morning and started my Windows 10 machine from scratch (cold boot). I loaded Thunderbird and read and deleted some email. Then I went to enter a Task in the same calendar I always install Tasks in and it won't let me enter a new Task at all. The input field tells me to select a calendar that supports tasks. Well, I have! I open the Events and Messages menu option and the Enter Task command is grayed out. What the heck is going on? How can I get the ability to enter Tasks back?

I'm getting a little tired of dealing with all the issues in Thunderbird. I have spent hours trying to debug this with no success.
creator: steve669

title: Open Message In Conversation - Nothing is making it work properly
content:
Hi folks, having a nightmare with Open Message In Conversation. Its partly not working, or when it does, it doesn't include everything that it should be.

I have tried all of the listed previous suggestions (re-doing the global index etc...) on this forum.

Can you help?

When in my inbox: Open Message In Conversation is completely greyed out and does nothing.

When in my outbox: It opens the conversation up to the date of that email, but doesn't include any mails that are more recent anymore (ie. the full conversation). When clicking on the most recent sent mail, it only shows my own replies, and the received mail is no longer included in the conversation.

This is a recent thing to happen, and incredibly frustrating as it's killing my work flow.

If you have any suggestions, I will try them all to bring it back to how it was!

Cheers, Lee
creator: lee119
